clinical_study.brief_title: Cortical Excitability Using Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation and Neuronavigation Device
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Cortical Excitability in Healthy Subjects With Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) and a Neuronavigation Device

brief_summary.textblock:
This study has two main goals :
- to investigate the impact of aging on cortical excitability (CE)
- to investigate the impact of "state dependency" on CE, using a cognitive task and an emotional one.
A Neuronavigation system of transcranial magnetic stimulation is used, and electromyographic response are recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Amplitudes of Motor evoked Potentials (µV) for ICI and ICF.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for an expected average of one month
primary_outcome.description: Motor Evoked Potential (MEP) from the first dorsal interosseous are register during the stimulations. Intracortical Inhibition (ICI) and Facilitation (ICF) are a paired-pulse TMS measure of cortical excitability. A short Interval interstimuli (2ms) leads to a cortical inhibition, which reflects the GABAergic neurotransmission; whereas a longer interval interstimuli leads to a cortical facilitation, which reflects glutamatergic neurotransmission.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for an expected average of one month
primary_outcome.description: Cortical Silent Period (CSP) is a single-pulse TMS measure of cortical inhibition, stimulations are applied while subjects are exerting a muscular contraction of the thum-index pinch and lead to a muscular cancellation. Duration of this silence is measured.

arm_group.description: TMS performed at rest and during a cognitive/emotional task

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female
- age 18-75
- signed informed consent
- normal physical examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- less 18 or more 75 years of age
- contra indication to TMS: epilepsia or seizures, metallic head devices, cardiac pacemaker, pregnancy, jet lag or severe insomnia the night before
- severe physical disease
- treatment with psychotropic drugs
- overt psychiatric disease
- alcohol consumption before the examination
